quest.name: Staunch Conviction
journal: Lucia is concerned that you seem to be looking for something to do.

Resigned to the simple truth that you will never be content to do absolutely nothing, Lucia suggests that you take a stroll about Falcon's Nest and speak with the various peoples who have come to attend the conference. She also makes mention that lords Artoirel and Emmanellain should be nearby, as both have graciously volunteered their services.

Though they come from different walks of life, the Ishgardians with whom you speak all share a similar hope for peace, however unimaginable it might feel. The two young lords of House Fortemps are not difficult to find, but Emmanellain seems disinclined to conversation. Perhaps his older brother will be more obliging.

As you converse with Lord Artoirel about recent affairs, Lucia abruptly appears and announces that a party of Convictors has refused to stand down, and have instead pledged to engage any Dravanians they spy flying towards Falcon's Nest. Needless to say, such an act could spell disaster for the peace conference, and the first commander intends to ride out to the Convictory and resolve the situation in person. Lord Artoirel, she feels, would only strengthen her claim, as he can speak with the authority of House Fortemps. The young lord agrees, and before he departs he asks that you look after his younger brother, who he fears may fail to carry out his duties in his absence.
objectives: Speak with the people of Falcon's Nest.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: Will it truly be enough, I wonder...

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: Ah...still here, old girlboy? This, uh...this really isn't the time.

dialogue.name: HONOROIT
dialogue.text: (I will do my utmost to keep him out of trouble, but I may require your assistance later...)

dialogue.name: CITIZENA02233
dialogue.text: Have you peeked behind the curtain? Care to tell us what you saw?

dialogue.name: CITIZENB02233
dialogue.text: I suppose we came a bit early, didn't we? Nevertheless, better early than late!

dialogue.name: CITIZENC02233
dialogue.text: More and more folk are drifting into Falcon's Nest. Most ain't quite sure what to expect, I reckon. Quite frankly, neither am I...

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: If you would rather not take a rest, then why not take a walk around Falcon's Nest? Make your presence known to the people and so forth.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: In addition to those who have come from far and wide to attend this ceremony, you may meet lords Artoirel and Emmanellain, who have graciously volunteered their services.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: They should be glad to see you. Now, if you would excuse me, I must needs return to my duties.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: Taking a stroll around the hamlet? Very good, very good. We shall speak anon.

dialogue.name: ROTHE
dialogue.text: Bloody excitin', isn't it? Not just peace with the dragons, but with all them heretics besides!

dialogue.name: ROTHE
dialogue.text: Don't misunderstand─we've all got a healthy fear of being bathed in dragon fire. That being said, the heretics did far more to hinder our efforts here in the past, so hearin' that we're close to a reconciliation comes as a great relief!

dialogue.name: ROTHE
dialogue.text: If the dragons haven't got reason to fight, then neither will the heretics. Thank the Fury for that.

dialogue.name: REDWALD
dialogue.text: I am glad to see that the rumors were true! Well met, MistressMaster Surname, and fear not─I've no intention of begging your aid with this or that. Everything appears to be in order.

dialogue.name: REDWALD
dialogue.text: My only lingering concern is that one of the Convictors might not have been informed of our plans. As I recall, Vidofnir may pass directly over their encampment.

dialogue.name: REDWALD
dialogue.text: The last thing we need is a glory-seeking nobleman attempting to slay a Dravanian ambassador to a peace conference...

dialogue.name: REDWALD
dialogue.text: Pay me no mind. Worrying over unlikely possibilities is my duty. Yours is to relax and enjoy the festivities.

dialogue.name: CITIZENA02233
dialogue.text: Do you know when everything's set to begin? I wasn't sure how many might come, so I thought it best to come early and find a spot with a great view.

dialogue.name: CITIZENA02233
dialogue.text: When I heard that Ser Aymeric was planning to make a speech, I knew I couldn't miss it. I mean, the man risked his own neck to rescue those hostages! How often do we get heroes like that in this day and age?

dialogue.name: CITIZENA02233
dialogue.text: And he's more than a fighter, too─he's a thinker, he is. He's got plans to better our lives. To change things. And he'll do it, by the Fury. Me and my friends and family, we all believe he can do it.

dialogue.name: CITIZENA02233
dialogue.text: Where is everyone else? Don't they know what they're missing?

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: How much has changed since we fought alongside each other in the Vault. If you had told me then that we would soon be hosting a peace conference, I would have thought you a naive fool.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: Yet here we are, preparing to make that fantasy a reality. Hah─and here I am, laboring to make it so.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Lord Artoirel, if I may.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: Certainly, First Commander. How may I be of service?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Some of the Convictors are refusing to stand down.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: The majority were willing to do so, but a small party have instead pledged to engage any Dravanians bound for Falcon's Nest.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: Fury take me, they would defy Ser Aymeric's commands!? If they dare attack Vidofnir─

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: It will not come to that. But to see that it does not, we must needs hasten to their encampment.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: They should be far more reluctant to oppose us were a lord of House Fortemps present.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: I understand completely. Let us depart at once.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: But ere we do, I must ask: would you look after Emmanellain while I am away?

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: As you know, he has ever been an impulsive, changeable child, but recently he seems to have been suffering from a bout of melancholy.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: I thought to lift his spirits by having him assist with guard duty─a simple but honorable charge, unlikely to expose him to danger given the presence of so many other knights. Alas, he has taken no interest, and I fear he may abandon his post in my absence.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: All I ask is that you keep an eye on him until I return...exhausting though that may be.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: Thank you, my friend. I promise we will not be long.
